text: The 60 metres at the 1930 Women's World Games was held in Prague at the Letná Stadium, from 6 to 7 September 1930. 19 athletes from 11 nations competed in the event. ==Entrants== In August 1930 entrants were published of the athletes of 5 nations: the Netherlands, Sweden, Switzerland, Italy and Great Britain. Listed below are the athletes from these nations who were entered for the 800 metres events. Nationality Name ==Results== ===Heats=== The heats took place on 6 September 1930. ====Heat 1==== Rank Name Nationality Time Notes 1 Marguerite Radideau 7.8 Q 2 Zdeňka Smolová 8.1 Q? 3 Luka 8.4 ====Heat 2==== Rank Name Nationality Time Notes 1 Stanisława Walasiewicz 7.7 Q 2 Lisl Perkaus 8.2 Q? 3 Tina Steiner 8.4 ====Heat 3==== Rank Name Nationality Time Notes 1 Ethel Scott 8 Q 2 Lisa Gelius 8 Q 3 Lidia Bongiovanni 8.4 ====Heat 4==== Rank Name Nationality Time Notes 1 Rosa Kellner 13.2 Q 2 Veronika Kohlbach 13.6 Q? 3 Martin 13.7 ====Heat 5==== Rank Name Nationality Time Notes 1 Kinue Hitomi 7.8 Q 2 Ivy Walker 7.9 Q? 3 Anna Hřebřinová ===Semi-finals=== The semi-finals took also place on 6 September 1930. The first two persons of each semi-final qualified for the final.page7 ====Semi-final 1==== Rank Name Nationality Time Notes 1 Kinue Hitomi 7.8 Q 2 Lisa Gelius 7.8 Q 3 Ethel Scott 7.9 ====Semi- final 2==== Rank Name Nationality Time Notes 1 Stanisława Walasiewicz 7.8 Q 2 Rosa Kellner Q 3 ====Semi-final 3==== Rank Name Nationality Time Notes 1 Marguerite Radideau 7.8 Q 1 Ivy Walker 7.8 Q 3 Anna Hřebřinová ===Final=== The final of the 60 metres event took place on Sunday 7 September, with bad weather conditions. Rank Name Nationality Time Notes Stanisława Walasiewicz 7.7 Lisa Gelius 7.8 Kinue Hitomi 7.8 4 Ivy Walker 8.0 5 Marguerite Radideau 8.1 5 Rosa Kellner 8.2 Source: ==Related pages== *Athletics at the Olympics of Grace – 60 metres ==References== Category:Athletics at the 1930 Women's World Games
title: Athletics at the 1930 Women's World Games – 60 metres
